review.title: An Automated System for Essay Scoring of Online Exams in Arabic based on Stemming Techniques and Levenshtein Edit Operations
review.abstract: In this article, an automated system is proposed for essay scoring in Arabic language for online exams based on stemming techniques and Levenshtein edit operations. An online exam has been developed on the proposed mechanisms, exploiting the capabilities of light and heavy stemming. The implemented online grading system has shown to be an efficient tool for automated scoring of essay questions.

metadata.title: An Automated System for Essay Scoring of Online Exams in Arabic based on Stemming Techniques and Levenshtein Edit Operations

sections.text: This article proposes an automated system for essay stemming techniques and Levenshtein editing processes. Among the proposed mechanisms, an online review has been developed using the possibilities of easy and heavy stamping. The implemented online review system has proven to be an efficient tool for the automated assessment of essay questions.Keywords: automated essay scoring, online reviews, Stemming, Levenshtein operations, distance editing, Arabic language, natural language processing

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: Recently, automated grading systems have gained attention for their convenience over traditional grading systems; the fast-growing trust in education technology [1] and the increasing number of students has highlighted the need for an efficient scoring mechanism to completely replace the teacher's role in the scoring process, while saving time and guaranteeing fairness; the Automated Scoring (AS) process deals with evaluating a student's response by comparing it to a model; several types of tools and web services have been developed with the aim of performing automatic scoring of online exams with little or no user intervention.

sections.heading: 2. Related Works
sections.text: One of the most commonly used AES models is presented in [3] other AES models: [2] and [1] However, due to its complexity, it is extremely difficult to implement the aforementioned mechanisms for the Arabic language, as they are highly inflexible and ambiguous in the absence of diacritics. There have been few attempts in research on the subject, and so far none of them have been able to provide a fully functioning automatic assessment system. In [4], the authors proposed an Arabic web-based assessment system where students can log in with a username and password to take online exams, exam questions are stored on the server along with correct answers, and the answers are automatically graded by comparing the correct answer to the student's answer. However, the proposed system did not provide an automatic assessment for essay questions, answers to such questions are sent to the instructor for manual evaluation, which are then returned to the system.

sections.heading: 3. Problem Statement
sections.text: It is clear from the previous section that there is a lack of research on the automated grading of essay questions in Arabic. The majority of available research results do not fully implement the proposed techniques and often require manual grading by an instructor at a specific point. An efficient automated grading system for Arabic essay questions should prove that it has the following features: fully automated grading capabilities without human intervention, low computer complexity to enable rapid grading and easy implementation for web services that correspond to the nature of online exams. Efficient handling of the various complex aspects in Arabic. This article aims to solve the existing problem by developing an automated essay grading mechanism that is both efficient and less complex for use in online web-based examinations without requiring manual grading.
